bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 8, 1899

div1.p: Lazear reports that Mabel Lazear is recovering nicely.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 8, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE, Feb 8 99
My dear Mother,
div1.p:
Your letter came this morning,
also the pajamas for which I thank you very
much They are very nice indeed. One cannot
get that kind in Baltimore except made
to order. Mabel continues to do
nicely. There were annoying after pains
yesterday but today she is perfectly
comfortable. My letter to Mrs Houston
should have reached her Monday
evening I mailed it at the Scateau and
put a special delivery stamp on it.
As for the envelopes, I prefer them plain.
The name on the outside is useless and
is rather bad form I think.

Mrs. Houston's letter has just come I am
glad you are going to see the “Walkers”.
div1.closer:
Your affectionate Son. Be sure and let me know on what
trains you are coming.
